visits.clinician_note:
Presenting Complaint:
38-year-old woman presents for routine 6-monthly review. No specific complaints. Mentions mild fatigue over the past 2 months which she attributes to her busy work schedule.

Current ARV Regimen:
TDF/3TC/DTG (TLD) fixed-dose combination once daily. On this regimen for 3 years.

Previous ARV Regimens:
AZT/3TC/NVP for 2 years (2018-2020), switched to TLD in 2020 due to national guideline transition.

Medical History:
HIV diagnosed 2018. No diabetes, no hypertension. Adherence consistently >95% by pill count. No known allergies. Takes ibuprofen 400mg occasionally for headaches (approximately 2-3 times per week for the past 6 months due to work stress).

Examination Findings:
BP 118/76 mmHg. Weight 64kg (stable). No peripheral oedema. No costovertebral angle tenderness. Otherwise unremarkable.

Laboratory Results:
Creatinine: 1.4 mg/dL (previous values: 0.9 in 2020, 1.0 in 2021, 1.1 in 2022, 1.2 in 2023). eGFR: 52 mL/min/1.73m2 (CKD-EPI). Urinalysis: Protein 1+, glucose trace. Viral load: <50 copies/mL. CD4: 584 cells/uL. Hb: 12.8 g/dL.

Presenting Complaint:
52-year-old man presents with 3-week history of generalized weakness and decreased appetite. Also notes his urine appears 'foamy' recently.

Current ARV Regimen:
TDF/3TC/DTG (TLD) for 4 years.

Previous ARV Regimens:
None. ART-naive when started on TLD.

Medical History:
HIV diagnosed 2020. Type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed 2019, on metformin 1g BD and glibenclamide 5mg BD. Hypertension diagnosed 2021, on amlodipine 10mg OD and lisinopril 10mg OD. Completed TB treatment (2RHZE/4RH) in 2022. Takes co-trimoxazole 960mg OD for prophylaxis. Recent course of gentamicin IM for presumed UTI 6 weeks ago (given at local clinic).

Examination Findings:

BP 148/92 mmHg. Weight 78kg (was 82kg 6 months ago). Mild bilateral pedal oedema. No ascites. Fundoscopy: mild hypertensive changes, no diabetic retinopathy.

Laboratory Results:

Creatinine: 2.8 mg/dL (was 1.3 mg/dL 3 months ago, 1.0 mg/dL 1 year ago). eGFR: 24 mL/min/1.73m2. Urinalysis: Protein 3+, glucose 2+. HbA1c: 8.2%. Fasting glucose: 186 mg/dL. Potassium: 5.4 mEq/L. Phosphate: 2.1 mg/dL (low). Viral load: <50 copies/mL. CD4: 445 cells/uL.

Scenario Type
True Positive - DTG-associated weight gain with emerging metabolic syndrome

Presenting Complaint
36-year-old woman presents for routine review. Mentions her clothes no longer fit and she has gained 'a lot of weight' since starting her current HIV medication. Also feels more tired than usual.

Current ARV Regimen
TDF/3TC/DTG (TLD) for 18 months.

Previous ARV Regimens
TDF/3TC/EFV for 3 years prior to switch (switched due to persistent dizziness and vivid dreams on EFV).

Medical History
HIV diagnosed 2019. No diabetes or hypertension previously. Family history: mother has type 2 diabetes. No other medications.

Examination Findings
BP 138/88 mmHg (was 118/74 before TLD switch). Weight 82kg (was 65kg at TLD switch 18 months ago - gained 17kg). BMI 32.4 kg/m2 (was 25.6). Waist circumference 96cm. Acanthosis nigricans noted at neck and axillae. No peripheral oedema.

Laboratory Results
Fasting glucose: 118 mg/dL (impaired, was 92 mg/dL pre-switch). HbA1c: 6.1% (pre-diabetic). Fasting lipids: Total cholesterol 228 mg/dL, LDL 148 mg/dL, HDL 38 mg/dL, Triglycerides 212 mg/dL. Creatinine: 0.9 mg/dL (normal). Viral load: <50 copies/mL. CD4: 612 cells/uL.
